turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Waste management law.
turn.1: What is meant by universal application of the term solid waste?
turn.2: The most common and widespread such standard is a prohibition on littering.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Where a jurisdiction has authorized a specific place or system for trash collection, deposition or abandonment of trash elsewhere may be subject to civil or criminal penalties.
turn.5: Does the article mention any other interesting aspects?
turn.6: Other more specific disposal bans - from mandating that paint not be poured down drains, to specifying national repositories for radioactive waste - all act to govern the final resting place of various wastes.
turn.8: Still other wastes may be required to be separated for recycling, rather than disposal.
turn.9: Do any other countries have similar laws?
turn.10: All of these prohibitions are, in a sense, conditional, in that they do not outright ban the disposal of the material, but rather restrict the disposal location.
turn.11: What other aspects are there of the universal application?
turn.12: Waste disposal also may be restricted conditionally by requiring that a waste be treated in a specific fashion before it may be disposed of at a particular location.
